abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Second
            Hard Coal Sector Adjustment Loan Project (SECAL2) is to
            support implementation of the Government's 1998-2002
            Hard Coal Sector Reform Program. In particular, SECAL2 will
            support the Government in implementing the Revised Program
            which contains more extensive mine closures and employment
            reduction than in the original Program. Specific objectives
            relate to support for actions to 1) assist workers leaving
            the industry to find new jobs; 2) improve the industry
            payment of taxes and fees to government; 3) accomplish
            further progres regarding preparation for privatization; and
            4) continue progress to improve environmental performance.
            From the point of view of society, the immediate
            beneficiaries of social mitigation measures under the
            Program, and SECAL2, are the miners and their immediate
            dependents. There are four major risks: 1) Despite the
            extensive restructuring being undertaken under the Program,
            the industry may not become profitable. 2) The employment
            restructuring targets may not be achieved because of a
            slow-down in take-up of severance packages by miners. Many
            of the workers leaving the industry are women. 3) If the
            industry does not become profitable, then environmental
            performance may be restrained by a lack of funding. 4) Poor
            financial performance may also be a barrier to privatization.
